R0nbsr9tzuopGUi2uW8tIg.text: Shot pitchers here are so good!!! I also am a big fan of the grilled cheese and the spinach&artichoke dips/buffalo chicken dip! I got a wrap once and wasnt a huge fan because the meat was cold. The service is a little slow sometimes but its a great fix for the price. Especially the half off menu!

H71atCyCmbNymXeexN0RsQ.text: I'm surprised I've never written a review for here. I go there semi frequently. It's conveniently located near my work, so I go for lunch sometimes with coworkers, or sometimes after work for happy hour.  It's a college bar. It can get crowded and loud. There's nothing special about the drinks. They're not fancy cocktails, but sometimes it's good to just grab a rum and coke or a beer somewhere. This place is great for that. There tends to be a mix of all ages early on since a lot of university and hospital employees go for happy hours. It's louder and not really my type of place later on when the college kids really start taking over, but if you go earlier in the day, it's fine.  They have $5 food specials for lunch, mid afternoon and again late night, so lots of opportunities to score some cheap food. I like their wraps a lot, and really love the spinach artichoke dip. It's some of the best dip I've had.   It's not worth going out of your way for, but Hemingways is great if you're in the area and need to grab a quite bite or drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Love the spinach artichoke dip here. The wings are nice and crispy with Hems sauce.

-NhdkdhMqSt9U074sLeKSQ.text: I'm an advocate of a great dive bar.  I actually like going to dive bars because it is more entertaining and more of a laid back atmosphere.  I enjoy that type of setting in a bar.  But you will not find that here.  I wish they had a subgroup on Yelp that says "college bar" or something of the like.  Because that is what this truly is.  A college bar.  This isn't my first visit to Hemingway's but it will probably be my last (for the bar experience at least).  I have eaten here before, and from what I remember they have a great turkey burger, but I am focusing on the bar experience for this review.  The best way to experience this place is probably by coming here when there are no students in the area, that or don't come at all.  Tons of college kids everywhere with their "I know better" attitude (I can say that, I use to be one myself).  Which made for an uncomfortable experience for me.  I did my time in college and I don't like the vibe of a place like this anymore.  Oh how it feels to grow up.  Let's break it down some, besides this being your typical college bar they don't vary much on what is offered in regards to libations.  Limited beer selection and it appears that a majority of the liquor available is not top shelf.  Every beer I asked for they didn't have, on tap or bottled.  After my third try at getting a beer, I gave up.  No thank you to the gimmicky picture drinks you have either.  If I wanted to be hyper and drunk at the same time I wouldn't be here to do that.  I have no idea what the appeal of gummy worms in drinks is.    As far as the bartenders, rude.  If you see me struggling to see what you have available and shooting down every single beer I have selected, how about you either give me a list or tell me what you do have.  I don't need no shade thrown my way unless you want me to overwork my bitch look in your direction.  It's not my fault you are behind the bar with people yelling at you.

35H5kb4BeaNywZLgrBXVtw.text: This has always been my favorite place to go however, today I was ignored for 30 minutes by my waiter once the restaurant got busy. She walked by my table numerous times but did not acknowledge me even after I tried to get her attention. The long wait for my bill caused my parking meter to expire, resulting in a $40 ticket. This turned my $10 meal into a $50 expense. I'm very disappointed in the waitstaff.

57fsgcQ6LwBTX1tRbxlFMw.text: I love Hemingway's, I have been coming here for the past 2 years. I moved from Los Angeles for Grad School, and going to Hemingway's on Friday nights is always something I look forward to after a long, hectic week.  Hemingway's has excellent happy hour deals EVERYDAY (except Sundays, because they are closed). Also, their beer prices are the best in town. I have never seen such low beer prices in my life. I always get the $5 Miller lite pitcher, such an awesome deal. They also do daily beer specials (check out their website for the deets), my friends and I used to show up every Thursday after class for the $2 pint of dogfish head. :)  Anyhoo, the wait staff always does such a fantastic job (shout out to Lindsay aka "Hoagie", she is one of the best!). My only gripe about the place is that it gets suuuuper packed at night, around 10-11pm. But I'm not complaining because it gives Hemingway's business and allows them to keep the prices low. Love this place and I will always remember it where ever I end up :)

uAVnhJQNDG76hxN1RqJqFg.text: Ordered a burger that came to take undercooked although it was a premade Patty. I broke off a corner to bite the piece hanging outside the bun, and immediately had to sit it out due  to the raw, freezer burned taste of it. When the server took it away, she came back and said the policy is not to exchange it refund any food. I explained how I would not pay for inedible food and could get something to replace it. The server went to get the manger, who proceeded to tell me the but was not under cooked. We asked did she taste it? She did no she's did thousands and they are all cooked perfectly!!! She then stated she would not replace or refund the burger; however the ENTIRE burger went to the back never to be seen again. I am the states away from home and would warn anyone visiting Pittsburgh to steer clear of Hemingway's

aefYlxt7SAWYBv0TKOyELQ.text: Hem's is the ideal dive bar: it's local, convenient, cheap, and VERY difficult for underagers to get in.  Several of my experiences with Hem's involve late night shot pitchers with a group of friends, but most recently I went to happy hour at Hem's with a friend and we ended up spending the night eating apps, drinking several pitchers, and playing trivia. At first, the bar was empty, but Hem's isn't usually the go-to happy hour place. After a while, more people came for food, drinks, and trivia, and in no time the room had a nice din to it.   We ordered the spinach artichoke dip, a summer shandy pitcher, a miller lite pitcher, cheese fries, and two bottles of blue moon (yeah, we had ourselves a day). Promoters were even walking around with free shots, which were quite delicious!!   Out of the two appetizers ordered, I enjoyed the spinach artichoke dip more. The dip was quite thick but flavorful, and the pita was fried, which left the pita a tad greasy and heavy with the rich, creamy dip. Nonetheless, still a great option if you're looking to indulge. On the other hand, the cheese fries were not that impressive to me. It seemed as though they put shredded cheese on bland fries and broiled it. I do not think I will spring for that option again.   In terms of libations, the beer was COLD and PLENTIFUL. At the end of the night, I expected to get bombarded with a huge check, but all of that was still under $15. In conclusion, you can get drunk for cheap, and the eats are decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A great view of the bar (and my friends). It has that &#34;where everybody knows your name&#34; vibe, don&#39;t you think?
Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The beer was cold and refreshing, so refreshing we drank it up so fast!
Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheese fries: the aftermath

aTiecTzBYP83hz9FNG8ECg.text: This place has specials for cheap beer and decent food so what more could you ask for in a college town. They also offer trivia on Tuesdays and music trivia in Wednesday's where you can win prizes. Look out for their happy hour because food is way cheaper. My go to foods are the totchos and chicken wrap. They also offer these shot pitchers which aren't very expensive considering how much alcohol you get. These can be shared or for yourself!

NSWV3TorACftrl6rpnwsGw.text: Hem's is a must-try bar and cafe located in the heart of the University of Pittsburgh's Main (Oakland) Campus. Hem's has been voted one of America's best college bars, and it definitely deserves that. The food here is delicious, and it is especially worth it when it is half off (11am-12pm, 2pm-4pm, 9pm-12am)! ...but remember to tip on the full price even though food is half off! I highly recommend the pulled pork grilled cheese, the Philly cheesesteak wrap and the spinach-artichoke dip. And you must get their sweet potato fries! They have some of the best sweet potato fries. During half off hours, they'll charge you $1 if you don't buy a drink, but you'd be crazy to go in here and not get yourself a shot pitcher (unless you're under 21). I think the Long Island shot pitcher is the best bang for your buck (and it comes with gummy worms on top). Most of the shot pitchers are pretty great, with a few being kind of gross. But the gummy worms are definitely worth the buy. At night, this is one of the best bars in Oakland. Sometimes it can get overcrowded, but it is generally still super fun. The DJ isn't always the best and the ones that are there don't actually care about properly DJing (proper transitions, etc.) but I like that they sometimes take requests. Lindsey is the best bartender and waitress there because she is the nicest, friendliest, and most attentive! Overall, great bar and I love the food, atmosphere, and drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Philly cheesesteak wrap (off-menu) with sweet potato fries

BdxLxb24uO59dT9PtGUhPQ.text: They have pitchers of beer for relatively cheap. The shot pitchers are super sweet, the only one that I like is the long island. I do like their pierogies and cardiac sticks (basically mozzarella sticks with bacon and ranch, yum) and they have tons of food options for only $5 for late night specials. Their chips are nice, they're deep fried pita basically and there's buffalo chicken dip and spinach artichoke dip, both are good and served hot. The bad thing is that they only give you a few chips and charge you for more (which makes sense, but the initial chip serving is really stingy!) It does get really crowded on weekend nights because it is a college bar.

M4fFc9QHH5A2KJENW_3MQw.text: As a student in Pittsburgh, it seems that Hemingway's is a rite of passage.  To mark the end of my first semester of graduate school, my friend and I came here for some lunch time day drinking after an 8 AM final.  There were quite a few other students in there, mostly undergrads with a head start.  It was not terribly crowded but very loud.  Hemingway's has MULTIPLE happy hours.  Yes.  Lunch time from 11 AM to 12 PM happens to be a happy hour with half priced sandwiches!  What?!?!  Instantly impressed.  Here are some food thoughts: Jolly Rancher Shot Pitcher ($7)- This had a quite a few shots within it, and I split it with my friend.  It was green apple flavored, but honestly, it was mostly sugar and not much alcohol.  I couldn't even feel the alcohol afterwards.  But the gummy worms in the pitcher were awesome.  Buffalo Chicken Wrap (Normally $8.99, $4.50 at happy hour)- The wrap was delicious.  Not too spicy, just right!  Probably one of the best versions of this wrap I've ever had.  I made the mistake, though, of opting for coleslaw over the french fries.  Bad decision.  Get the french fries!!!  They are seasoned and perfection!!!  Massive case of buyer's remorse.  The coleslaw was pretty boring.  Get the french fries.  Trust me.  My friend ordered a burger, and it was massive.  At the same price as my wrap, I was totally jealous.  The burger looked and smelled amazing, and I plan to get one when I come back.  Service isn't particularly fast, but most people are there to just hang out, so it is cool.  The service was very friendly and good, though.  The only odd thing is that if you do NOT order a drink, there is a $1 up-charge.

photos.caption: Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Buffalo Chicken Wrap... 1/2 price 11 Am to 12 Pm ... Normally $8.99, and some remnants of our jolly rancher shots.

g20_mG-Zqfda1flJdFNFGg.text: During my grad school days Hemingway's Cafe was a staple.  My friends loved ordering the quirky 'buckets of shots' with names like, Lady GaGa and Taylor Swift.  As someone over 30 I couldn't in good conscious order a pitcher of shots (without becoming ill from the insane amount of sugar and alcohol) but no worries, because "Hems" always has a great selection of beer on draft.  The grad school crew favorite was the pita chips and artichoke dip.  Rich, creamy and full of fat.  And delicious.  The I-Need-To-Eat-Healthy version of myself loves the selection of wraps, with the hot honey wrap taking center stage.  Instead of fries I always opt for mashed potatoes.    The wait staff here is great and have worked there for many years.  They're friendly and go out of their way to make sure you're enjoying yourself and that your glass is never empty.    The atmosphere is pure college.  Small booths and crowded throughways.  So turn your nose down and enjoy it for what it is - a great college bar and restaurant.

SsZZlT8JlNHLXXZH4IkM_A.text: Good food and good alcohol selection whether you like beer or mixed drinks served in pitchers. Seasonal bar. Crowd depends on whether or not Pitt is in session or not

5NpxvQM8GNi50y1x_-vpWQ.text: This is a very good bar.  The bar itself is more of a college crowd. It gets very crowded with students on weekend nights. The bar itself isn't well designed to give ample room and people are crammed together. But hey, maybe that's a good thing. The drinks are cheap though.  Regarding food, this place has good bar food and some cheap food depending on if you are in time for the five dollar menu. I really liked the panther stix, the bacon fries, and the Cobb salad. I STRONGLY RECOMMEND AGAINST THE BURGER. It tastes like a kickball ball.  Yet, this is an Oakland classic and you really need to visit.

UByhw377HTlIbUd5B8yrWQ.text: Hem's is a staple for any Pitt student. You really can't beat the $5.50 food menu that they offer multiple times a day, $2.75 daily IPA special, or the $4 shot pitchers from 10pm-midnight. The food is actually pretty good for a college bar. They have a decent amount of vegetarian and vegan options, including 3 new dishes with jackfruit! The real winner here is the spinach artichoke dip, served with fresh fried pita. So. Good. The drinks are all reasonably priced, and they have a pretty good beer list.  I took away a star because it always feels kind of...sticky inside no matter what time it is, but especially as the night goes on. Also, a lot the shot pitchers are WAY too sweet. You'll get a massive headache the next day from the sugar before the alcohol.

photos.caption: Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach Artichoke Dip

qOe99IVYqoyJ5-VkQBmJgQ.text: Been here twice ever, both during the summer season when school was out.   Was still fairly busy, but apparently not the same traffic as normal  Not sure if this is a Pittsburgh thing in general or just here, but $5 pitchers of bud light all day every day  Also, there are three sessions of happy hour daily  Cheap drinks and three daily happy hours? Yes please

xQQR12fbyH4IP9BH3cF7Vg.text: One of Pitt's college bars that never disappoints in the food scene. All of their apps are so good if you're in the need for tasty but cheesy and unhealthy snacks.   Trivia tuesdays are also a good time and most apps are half off with drink specials!  My all time favorite is the spinach and artichoke dip. The artichokes  not overwhelming in the dip flavor but the chunks are perfectly flavorful with a tad of spice! the pita chips are probably the best part! Crispy and fried yet thick enough for it to be filling.   Cardiac sticks are dressed with a nice tangy buffalo sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YgZj6kc9abzOBCevSA-8Gg.text: Hem's is almost every 21+ college kid's go-to hangout spot, and deservedly so. Their deals are unbeatable. You have to be careful with what you order though because not everything is excellent.   The Long Island shot pitcher is Thursday's special ($4 after 10:00 PM) and brings in massive Thursday night crowds. It's definitely worth it. The jack honey pitcher is also pretty good. Some of the other shot pitchers are too sweet. Most of the food menu is $5.50 from 9 PM-12 AM. The tortellini big plate and the spinach artichoke dip are my personal favorites. Both are super creamy and delicious. The portion sizes are generous.   For a late night hangout, you can't get better than Hems. If you go on a Thursday night while school is in session, expect huge crowds after 9, but on most other weeknights the atmosphere is a bit more relaxed.

photos.caption: Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tortellini and shot pitcher

np24cxOA5kMVRV70lKZk6w.text: I don't know where to begin with Hem's. It's a small bar on Forbes that if you weren't looking for it, you easily could miss it. But that's what makes it so great. On the inside, it's narrow and long so when it's packed, it's kind of hard to move around and walk through the crowd. In the back they have a more open area with a few tables but I have to say that this area is my least favorite spot in the bar. It reminds me of a church hall that you would throw a raffle party in or something. I always gravitate to the front area and when I'm there, I have a great time.   Hem's is most certainly known for their shot pitchers and half off food. Both live up to that hype in my opinion. On certain nights, they do half off a particular shot pitcher from 10-12. The best and the most popular is the Thursday Long Island Pitcher night. I mean, who doesn't love LIT for under $4? In addition to the pitchers, they have great deals on beer and a wide variety of craft beers to chose from.   The food is another story. They have a pretty extensive menu that expands beyond typical bar food. They have pastas, sandwiches, salads, burgers, wraps, and a variety of appetizers. I always get a wrap or a burger. My favorite being the Baja burger but swapped with a veggie burger. It is to die for. I also always get their mashed potatoes for a side. The mashed potatoes are their best kept secret because they are AMAZING. The best time to go is when they do their $5.50 menu. It's from 11-12, 2-4, and 9-12. I think that's when it's most worth it just because some of the portions are a little small for costing $9+.   Hem's is an Oakland classic and I will always love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Baja burger with mashed potatoes and a Jack Honey pitcher.

92vqBgybph696gkvzWKdrQ.text: I got this grilled cheese and it is so good!! It had bbq pulled pork, mac and cheese, and more cheese on top. there are a lot of side options too. It definitely hit the spot for food you want with drinking. I got three 12oz southern tier IPA and all three cost $7 like WHAT A DEAL. definitely crowded with college kids but they had trivia last night (Wednesday). shot pitchers have a special each night of the week where they're $4 or $5 between 10-12. the service isn't great i think they need more servers to help out with the food orders. our waitress was really nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoke house grilled cheese

tmiZI-eQ5UbvpphfwpBNew.text: How is it I have never reviewed this local institution? I have spent enough time at Hemingway's to have done so. Oh well better late than never. It's a popular place and it always has been so there are times when it is filled with people and they are flat out busy. But service is never a let down, no matter how busy they get. My boyfriend always gets the wings, I like the salads and apps. The nachos are good too. Prices=cheap and affordable.

fS3iDeDp0lJAxGJJjwDLMw.text: I was talked into trying this as THE bar in Oakland. I liked the decor a lot, very cozy feeling.   The bar gets crowded early and quick so you're a little squished if you choose bar top. It was a beautiful day outside and they turned off the lights which bothered me a bit. I don't want to drink in the dark at 5pm.   Music was fun and not so loud that you couldn't hear yourself think. Drinks were good and strong, tons of choices on the menu. Bartenders were personable and quick which I appreciate. Prices are a little much during non-Happy Hour Times but still reasonable.   I would return but maybe later in the evening where it doesn't feel as odd sitting in the dark.

ZE6u61DscilnZ3B0xdw-tQ.text: My sister took me here when I was visiting and I had a great time. $4 alcohol pitchers of the day start at 10PM, and most of their menu becomes 50% off as well. Definitely a great value for a night out.

bxeAStn2ysKy1GsHpJpVWQ.text: This is THE official bar of The University of Pittsburgh. Don't come at me arguing for Peter's Pub, Garage Door, Pittsburgh Cafe, Uncle Jimmy's, etc. You are wrong. And yes, I'm aware some of those places no longer currently exist. Hemmingway's will outlast them all anyways.  If you go there, it will probably be crowded, and almost no patrons will be over the age of 25. Much of their menu is either greasy and/or fried, but if you are there during one of their (many) food special window times, it will be cheap(er). One aspect that has evolved is their beer selection. Namely, it's substantially better than you'd expect for the area. Flights are available. They also have a diverse selection of shot pitchers. The alcohol content of them is questionable, but if you're drinking something neon-colored with a group of people, it's more about having fun and socializing anyways.   During the daytime I'm sure people will stop in for a sandwich and a beer, but once the sun goes down the ambience is that of a college house party. They know they have to appeal to modern college kids who can access ride-sharing with a push of a button and aren't just stranded in Oakland anymore. They do this with a diverse menu full of comfort food and cheap drinks, and it works. Weeknights have occasional bar trivia. Weekends usually have a DJ. If Pitt is in session, Hemmingway's is packed.  I'm in my 30's now and I rarely go there anymore, unless it's before a Pitt basketball game, which is well within walking distance. When I do go though, it reminds me of college and my early 20's, when I was there far more often than I'd like to admit. This is a cheap college bar, and if you look at it through that lens, it's one of the best. If I were basing this review solely on emotion and nostalgia, it's an automatic five stars from me. For someone who doesn't have the same connection but is willing to brave the undergrads, expect a four star experience for beer selection and pricing.

mdjpUrgb8dTIdPt0OC2t7Q.text: Not to be dramatic but I think I would die for this place. Thursdays are the best days to go (Long Island shot pitcher, come on). The food is amazing (sweet potato tots, spinach and artichoke dip, wraps, nachos, and HUMMUS) and pretty cheap when you go for the specials. And recently when I went there, they had vegan options??? LOVE to see it. Love all of the waiters and waitresses, and the bouncers are super cool and bend your ID basically in half so it's not a fake. I love this place so much and if i'm being honest, the only thing I'll miss about Pittsburgh is this place.

7QOSJCfyE-kGt7bSUBcm0A.text: Are you even a Pitt student if you haven't been to Hemingway's? Cheap beer that you can order by the glass or pitcher and decent bar food- you can't go wrong. I usually order the buffalo chicken wrap with tots (highly recommend) but most recently we just ordered some appetizers. The spinach dip was quite good. This is a great spot for lunch or a late night meal, as they have food specials during those times. It's also a place I visited for happy hour many times. It's a classic college bar, but it's awesome.

YTgEVXWAWbBQ8zVfbuVpjQ.text: I only ever go to Hem's for their $5 menu but honestly they have it so often throughout the day, it feels like they always have it haha.  I love love love love their spinach and artichoke dip. I get it every time. Ask for the pita warmed rather than fried, tastes better in my opinion and also makes you feel a little less guilty. Burgers are delicious and huge and it's totally worth swapping for sweet potato fries for an extra $1. Salads are also really big and delicious as well.  I come here somewhat often but I don't ever think I've had something that I did NOT like. Good food with huge portions for only $5? It's hard to be disappointed with that. They have beer specials daily as well as $4 pitchers starting from 10 PM which is always totally worth it in my opinion. Come in for late night dinner at 9 PM (for $5) and then grab a pitcher to start your night! Always a blast every time and the service can get kinda sparse sometimes when they get super packed with people, but they always do the best that they can. And I always seem to get the same waitress every time and she's awesome each time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mother of Dragon pitcher: only $4 on Saturdays after 10 PM!
Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. All food from their $5 menu, totally worth it!!

4yP_5pnVTPhKOwxZZ8yR_g.text: I don't know what is about hems-maybe the 2.75 Ipa deal every day-but it's got a special place in my heart. It's got a lovely divey atmosphere and has great food and drink deals in general. At times it can be really crowded, so you have to go at the right time. I may be so fond of it because I tend to avoid when it's flooded with people.

kI9fjuog6OE0GaIz2OpLJQ.text: My boyfriend and I come to Hems at any time of the day, at least 3 times a week! Cheap yet yummy American college food with a lot of happy hour times during the day, plus who doesn't love the shot pitchers? Favorite shot pitchers are Cathy on Acid, Mother of Dragons, the NEW White Walker ( love how the staff is also a huge Game of Thrones fan), and the mason jar cocktails are mouthwatering too! My favorite memories as a Pitt student have taken place at Hems. You can go in at 1 pm or 1 am and still have a great time there. Thank you Hems!!!

iUmsH39HQNmJAaLpQ49mJQ.text: One of my favorite bars around Oakland. The $5 menu is one of my favorite things about this place. A full portion for half-the-usual price. The burgers here are a little subpar but the rest of the menu has plenty of variety to make up for it. 10 wings for $10 are probably the best in the area in terms of flavor + value.  The shot pitchers here are very good in value and include gummy worms that I really enjoy.

odaiDXD_cHtZryY7Qc4UNw.text: I have been going here since I was a freshman in college (2001). I love Hemingway's but you have to know what you are getting yourself into. No they do not have the best food, service or cleanliness... you go because thats what you did when you went to Pitt.  Every few months I meet my friends from college at Hemingway's. They have $5 off the menu from 11am-12pm. I typically order one of the grilled cheeses that are decent. This time I switched it up and ordered the one with crab cake. It was pretty good.  The place was packed because of finals week. There were tons of drink specials and late night food specials for the students.  If you didn't come here in college you probably wouldn't like it but I will continue to return!

u5rZH2M0Bx-J6llglpAY-A.text: Ah, Hemingway's. The holy grail for Pitt Litchfield Towers freshman. Every weekend, countless Towers residents walk past the tempting allure of Hem's bumping music and sidewalk vomit on their way to a fruitless, South Oakland party search. Built into the structure of the University's iconic residence halls, Hem's is a awesome spot for several reasons.  During the day, Hem's is a great place to grab a drink and a bite to eat. The menu is pretty extensive, and "Tot-Cho's" (tater-tot nachos) are (in)famous member of trans fat culture. Throughout the day, $5 meal deals cover about 72% of the menu. There is a daytime slot and a nighttime slot. Beware, a $1 "drink charge" is a applied if you don't buy one yourself.  Hem's can be a wild place on weekends. It combines everything that makes a good college bar. A DJ to dance to, drink deals each night, and plenty of corners to hunker into if you need to have a serious talk with some friends. From about 9PM-midnight (check me on that), Hems offers a $4 shot pitcher. It's essentially mixed drink in a giant water pitcher. Each night is a different "special" and each are effective in reducing braincells as desired. Drink choices are extensive, and I've barely scraped the surface of the beers they offer. You're bound to run into people you know at Hem's, as it is the bar of choice for many of those involved on campus.  Hemingway's is a staple of the Oakland and Pitt experience. The diversity of experiences and awesome memories I've formed with my friends will have us returning to the bar as creepy 30-somethings, trying to relive moments our collegiate pasts.

photos.caption: Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Made lots of faces at people in the window that night
Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Clout Game
Photo of Hemingway's Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;The Boys&#34;

2lOdpyLLlp4-6mDrzIP0Tg.text: We have moved from Oakland 4 years ago but it's fun to go to Hems and reminisce on our early 20s.  Food is no longer half price after 9 but instead it's a 5 dollar menu but excludes some items. Pitcher drinks are still good. Vibe is still chill.

ZtWo7sDBHg8lXcQL124kzA.text: This place was definitely a dive and a half -- seat cushions were torn up, bathroom was cramped and old, the atmosphere dripped with dinginess -- but if you're cool with all of that, it's a great place.  They had a decent beer selection including all of the typical domestics and several craft beers.  While I didn't eat there, someone at the table next to me ordered a platter of pierogis that looked and smelled awesome.  I was there in the later afternoon on a Saturday and was surprised about just how packed it was in there.  People were literally lined up and waiting to to get a seat and standing room was almost non-existent by that point as well.  It was extremely loud in there so this isn't a great place for a quiet, intimate conversation, but if you'd like to shout at someone for several hours one evening, Hemingway's is your place!  Seems like a place with a high potential for fun, hijinx and revelry!

e3ZrBvGs7bYN-Q9NurnOXA.text: I'm at school at CMU, so I've only really been here to drink and to have fun - never for a meal.  So, how much you enjoy this place definitely depends on what you're looking for.  At night, college kids will flood this place and the atmosphere might get a little... claustrophobic.  But, if on the other hand, if you are one of those college kids, Hemingways is definitely a good place to be!  They have really cheap beer pitchers each night and they're really well-known for their 7 dollar shot pitchers.  The half-price food there at night is also really good.  I especially love the cloggen fries (mmm... bacon)

D1VyX9SAORvimR5qdaat-g.text: I'm definitely a fan of Hem's.  It's a cute bar/restaurant tucked in the Oakland university area.  If you come here, don't expect haute cuisine or anyting too complicated.  It's a bar, so expect bar-ish food.   What you SHOULD expect is: awesome drink prices/selection and an extensive half-price menu during select times.  Something like, before 11am, 2-4pm, and after 9pm most things on the menu are 1/2 price.  The garlic-parm wings with a side of fries is what I usually get and it's always great.  I wash it down with whatever draft specials they have.  They offer amazing draft specials daily ($1.50-$2.00), Yuengling pitchers for $5.50, and as other Yelper's have said, very reasonably priced PITCHERS of shots with names like Tiger Woods, Lady Gaga, and Miley Cyrus.  It gets busy on the weekends and after 9 in general.  I have come before on a Friday at 9:15 and was able to find a seat at the bar no problem and get a couple of drinks in before it got crowded and all hell broke loose.

OTieeZqN4uE4QMoz5UA9fw.text: Loud, greasy food, drunk college students, and exactly the experience that a bar sitting under a university building should be.

QJ3DElnRmXFlQHpLHIuewQ.text: Wednesday nights at Hem's were my favorite tradition as a Pitt undergraduate student.  $2 Blue Moon special.  An order of Pita Chips.  Karaoke.

quKm2s1qyh7MmJg5JVvqLg.text: This is THE LOUDEST restaurant/bar I have ever been in. We were seated at a 2-person booth leaning across the table and I still had to yell in my loudest voice to be heard. Albeit, it was a Saturday night, half-off food, and after the first Pitt football game of the season, but still. This is definitely not the place to go if you want to have any sort of intelligible conversation. However, if you want a place where you can belt out Eddie Money songs at the top of your voice, Hemingway's is the place to be.   PS. Food was so-so, but for half off it's hard to complain.

5HQNorckxxfRlrz-T3KKpw.text: This place was not nearly as gross as I anticipated. In the middle of Oakland, rusty sign... I mean the place screams undergrad. No thank you. I was persuaded to go here one Friday (after the semester was over) for happy hour, and had a good time. I mean, yes, you can buy pitchers of shots here, but you can also get Sam Adams in the 16oz super nice Sam Adams glass for $7 and keep the glass. It's pretty big inside, wasn't crowded or smokey, and the food was not that bad for bar food. I had a chicken, bacon, avocado wrap, and it was tasty. Friends had burgers, and they cleaned their plates. Hemingway's, you went from hideous undergrad hangout in my mind to an establishment I would patronize!

u06vV6692pLaH0pxKGqh5g.text: This place is great. Young crowd, cheap drinks ($1.50 select beers and $5 pitchers, can't beat that). I wouldn't come here for dinner, it's more of a dive bar than a restaurant. Definitely loud, crowded and messy which is not always a bad thing.

ElQbOAIKJfYaAryy0IyHWA.text: We came here for the cheap drinks so I can't speak on behalf of the food.   The place was packed with undergrads (and it was a tuesday night).  The draft selection is much better than I expected and luckily it was $2 draft night.  They also have $5 pitchers of miller all the time.  The service was friendly but it was extremely slow.  They also have a large girlie drink menu, and each drink comes with a candy necklace or a ring pop.

xvs9nZE44urY2MWUyslrlw.text: College bar staple with great half-price food, a large menu, and excellent beer specials.

uZ9uktOYWh-uXBC-yZUwGg.text: for those on a grad student budget like myself, hemingway's is perfect beginning at 11am and then again after 9pm for the 1/2 price food. i would definitely not pay full price for any of the food on the menu but i could literally come here for dinner every night for $3.50. not to mention, the drinks are cheap.   perfect place to pre-game or spend your whole weekday/night

pSLsdaywYO4sPrbW_Yt4sA.text: Recently ate at Hemingway's for lunch.  If you get there before 1145am you can order from the 1/2 off menu.  Most burgers, salads, wraps, sandwiches are on the 1/2 menu.    Ended up going for the buffalo chicken wrap which wasn't bad.  A bit scarce on the chicken (seemed to take a chicken strip and cut in half) but the taste was good.  We ordered the humus as an app which was really good.    All in all it was a cheap lunch, I would go back

giFEIKOSmx77vtFagE7w4w.text: great wings and other bar food, good beer specials.  Really cramped at night.  Went downhill once Danielle stopped bouncing.

-tnqO9J1PuBAt_2T2Zu2tA.text: Hemingway's is good at what it intends to do:  get college students drunk.  The drink selection is pretty terrible unless you like discount shots, with no top-shelf liquor and mediocre-at-best draft choices.  I never went here much as an undergrad, and I only go now before 9pm and only for the exceptional grilled cheeses--they have a great variety and all are made with thick Italian bread.  If you work in Oakland, you can't beat a delicious non-chain-restaurant sandwich for $5.99-7.99.

04GYPYEv7f8dwsY0uNF7rg.text: Reasonable priced draft beers.  They have Arrogant Bastard Ale on tap which makes my husband very happy.  Good service.  Bathrooms are fairly clean for a bar.

N1TkzoRWMfh9BYJdfq7-RQ.text: Hemingway's is a great place, and was visited at least once a week once I turned 21.  I never had a bad meal there.  My favorite was the Chicken Caesar Wrap.  It was a great place to go anytime, whether before or after class (but after class was a great time to unwind there).  One of the saddest things when leaving Pitt was leaving this place behind.  I live in a small town in rural Virginia now and wish there was a place anything close to the greatness of Hemingway's.

CjyGgsbp4gvoqSdEc-9xIw.text: Went here for a quick drink and food. My friend got the chicken wrap and tator tots and they were pretty tasty. They have a good beer selection, but I don't like beer so I tried the pitcher of Fuzzy Navel. In this case, the drink was wayyy too sweet, but I can't complain too much since it was only $5. I liked the little gummy worm surprise at the bottom (though it probably contributed to making the drink even sweeter). I'd get it again if there were more people to share the pitcher with, since it's too sweet to just share among two people. We then decided to get something to counteract the sweetness and ended up taking shots of whiskey. Yup, a great idea... but that's another story.

xUDRf_p3RdT5K7q-FrBjXg.text: Generally come here with some friends to drown our sorrows in beer after exams. It's a typical college bar but they do have really great specials on beer and food. If you want a artery-clogging taste of Pittsburgh, get the pierogi grilled cheese. It's worth the calories.

NRxzweTCD7ZyshCLWtoz5Q.text: Great beer specials but it's always over crowded and very noisy. It would be an awesome place if they could somehow do better crowd control. Pretty sure the fire marshal wouldn't be thrilled to see the sea of humanity within.

Ff9wYhlXOup9t-TgsCxVpQ.text: It's a nice sport bar around Oakland. I love Cloggin's fries and buffalo wings here. The fries are very crispy even there is cheddar cheese over them.

Me-ZPUyOfdVJ1_PuJ8kgKQ.text: Stopped here around 10 on a Saturday night and the crowd was just rolling in. The atmosphere is definitely college based but wasn't over the top rowdy. The service was excellent and the food was exactly as expected if not a little better. I was really blown away when I was told the majority of food was half off (not sure about the details but it was certain times and days) we had a party of 3 who all got burgers as well as spinach artichoke dip and the bill was barely over $20!!! This place rocks and I will definitely go back if I'm ever looking for a quick cheap meal that is above average (for a dive bar)

1McP5CGQN2A8zJzMg8ec4Q.text: Hey super-savers! Food, shots, candy necklaces! Cheap, slim, vundabar*!  *bar is not German

jWKXkIwFG8S-etISbyq2Pw.text: I want to like Hem's. Really, I do. The drinks are good, it's cheap, and great if you're a college student trying to get down (and by down, I mean drunk). However, a recent experience made me so furious that I never want to return and want everyone else to boycott the place.  To make what could be a long story short...my friends and I ordered top-shelf vodka shots on a Saturday night and were served shots of water. I kid you not. And when we confronted the bartender (I think her name was Lynn), she was rude and dismissive about the whole thing. I just couldn't even believe it! Very disappointing.

FxfcmQ0njdfWYfEbZoUCqw.text: If there is a bar that totally identifies with and even cherishes the fact it is a full blown college hang out, it is Hemingway's located at 3911 Forbes Avenue in Oakland. Its central location on the Pitt Campus draws a very young crowd looking to have a good time without traveling too far.  Though Hemingway's has some great specials (daily $1.75 beers, all day long) and a stellar beer selection, the set-up of this bar reduces its appeal. It is narrow to begin with and coupled with an awkward raised seating area spanning the middle complicates patron mobility. On a busy night it often takes five minutes to walk from the front to the back of the bar. Hemingway's has a pool table and dart board located in the back, but they are squeezed into a room entirely too small often making a game of billiards an unpleasant experience.  One aspect Hemingway's really has going for it is its staff. The same bartenders have been working here for as long as I can remember and they are good at what they do. Fast and efficient, even when the bar is at full capacity, they never short you on liquor in your mix drinks. Hemingway's also employs a number of wait staff to take food and drink orders and are a convenient option on packed nights.  The food here is not bad, and come between 9 and 11 and entrees are half off. Options from wraps, to burgers, to pasta dishes highlight the menu.  Don't expect anything great.  Just the normal cheap bar food.  The decor at Hemingway's is unique. Thousands of framed pictures of drunk college bar-goers cover every wall; a fitting choice for a college bar. It never gets old laughing at all the drunkards pictured here.  In conclusion, I think this bar is most suited for the newly turned 21 crowd. When you get a littler older, especially after graduation from college, the patronage here seems a bit juvenile. That being said, if you're looking for a cheap night out and some decent bar food for a great price then stop by Hemingway's.

kCLrebW6Xqf751KRdbt3_A.text: It's a college bar, but a good one.  A varied menu, reasonable prices, and good drink specials make Hemingway's a well-rounded place to grab a bite or a pint.  Nothing will blow you away, but it won't break the bank either.  (I can't recommend the burger, though--that one's a clear miss.)

OnRS-0Qr-xMkptVwdMIt8g.text: Place is decent, if you're looking to grab some quick food on Pitt game day. They have good sandwiches and wraps and is affordable.  I wouldn't recommend this place if you're looking for a quiet, clean atmosphere. It does have a frat basement smell to it, but that should come as no surprise.

esPA_RywBRcM2HtzEQLbBA.text: Great place to go before Pitt basketball game.  Great bar food and prices.

7OF4WzQ5OXUWsnFoVlrHug.text: Hemingway's does have half price food specials every day. Don't remember the exact hours but it's the late night and afternoon hours. They also have $1.75 draft specials each day.   The food here is decent but you go here to get drunk. This place is always packed with college kids. They are also really really strict with id's so if you have a fake, it may be hard to get in. At least it was a couple years ago when I was in college. There is a pool table, darts, gaming room at the back which usually isn't too crowded.   As for the food, you have to try the Cardiac Stix. Deep fried provolone sticks tossed with buffalo sauce, topped with cheddar jack cheese and bacon. Served with a side of bleu cheese dressing. Talk about a heart attack waiting to happen. We used to go here really late to just drink and maybe get some appetizers so I can't really say how good the food is besides the cardiac stix and the cloggin fries.

x1ux-YwXKbqvzP56Z1qNAw.text: No better bar in Oakland than this place. Between half off food at various times of the day, regular drink specials, shot pitchers and an over all amazing atmosphere this place is amazing. Without a doubt the best bar on this campus

8tTaUlXrKmcpU3prNvz8fw.text: Hem's has $5 pitchers and great french fries, a good place for munchies and beer after work (or class... or between classes... or, heck, when you should be in class).  Go there Wednesday night for karaoke, even if you just go twice you'll already know the regulars: the white college boys who try to rap, the girl who gets up and blows your mind, the oldest guy at the bar who sounds like a professional, the drunk foreign students who give American classics a great accent.

eHnxeZE63Yxg9mIMj_j7mg.text: Classic college bar.  Lots of college kids and drink specials targeted toward college kids - ie, pitchers of fuzzy navels and beer.   Food was OK but the service was goog .  The place was very lively especially later in the evening.

EDA0kEur0PwH52WxzQJ3GQ.text: Hem's is great if you're looking for some decent bar food at a great price, or to get drunk on a budget.  The only problem is that every other person in Oakland is looking to do the same thing.  After 9:00 on pretty much any night of the week, you'll be fighting 100 other people for your spot on the floor, or at the bar, or for the bartender's attention.  That being said, if yo're looking to get drunk, you won't care and you'll love the $2.00 drafts (for anything, even Troegenator!) after 10.  Pitchers of shots are also a favorite (Miley Cyrus, while a girly name, will kill you with liquor).  The jukebox is playing pretty traditional party rap or metal, depending on who gets to it first.  The bartenders are generous and totally on top of their game.  It's really a spectacular level of service for such a busy bar.    The lunchtime crowd is a lot more chill, it's a great place to sip a beer and eat a good wrap or burger for cheap!    BOTTOM LINE:  Good food and drinks cheap, great service, very crowded/loud, great for a night out to get hammered with a college crowd, not great for trying to chill out.

eBXpMVt4X-4-JbL07JuPfQ.text: Absolutely love this place! Near Carnegie Mellon and awesome half offs. In love with Karaoke nights on Wednesdays.

P3ZyL9JfNxn5VsnPZjko-g.text: I liked Hem's when I was in college, and I like it just as much post-college.  We went on Friday night for dinner, before the college kids had a chance to fill the place to capacity. We started with an old favorite- artichoke dip with baked pitas.  It was "super-spicy-and-my-face-is-burning-up" good.  For dinner, I had the philly chicken wrap.  It was okay, but the fries weren't as good (read: seasoned) as they used to be.  We were sad to see that the days of $1 Miller Lite are gone (circa 2006)- draft beer is $2.50 now!  Some guys tried to lure us to their table with promises of pitchers of shots  (Pitchers of shots?  Unreal)... but you know, we know better than that, right?  Overall, good service and better than average bar food.

RAremNlPW5Qm2PU4mPxBNw.text: Not happy with management decisions.  Bartenders were great and treated us very well, management however has global rules they impose on all patrons without assessing each individual situation.
